intro: Hieracium dovrensifolium, commonly known as the Dovresian Hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Alps. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are broadly lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowering period occurs from June to August, producing yellow flowers that attract various pollinators. Hieracium dovrensifolium is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in high-altitude environments.
